page.title: 01Cock Clarks/Purleigh
page.content: Cock Clarks and Purleigh are the two main communities within the 12 kilometre square block. In addition the hamlet of Hazeleigh lies just to the North. Apart from these, the area is predominantly rural, the vast majority of the land being given over to arable farming. There are substantial areas of woodland and numerous public footpaths traverse the locality. Isolated houses, both old and new, and many smallholdings are dotted around the region. Although really very close to the neighbouring towns of Maldon, South Woodham Ferrers and Chelmsford, this area is remarkably "cut-off" and its development as far as modern ammenities is concerned is surprisingly retarded.
